abstracts.cdata!:
The main components of the Agricultural
            Sector Adjustment Credit Project are: liberalizing domestic
            marketing and prices of traditional cereals at producer and
            consumer levels; liberalizing (external) trade in
            traditional cereals; liberalizing the consumer price of
            rice, the price of paddy, and the processing of rice;
            restructuring of the National Cereals Marketing Board, and
            limiting its role to the maintenance and management of food
            aid and food security stocks; reforming the agricultural
            trade regime - import policies and the determination of
            appropriate tariffs (pending the results of an ongoing
            tariff study) for the main imported agricultural
            commodities, including reforming the export price
            stabilization schemes for cotton and abandoning the schemes
            for groungnuts, sesame, and shea butter; to ensure that the
            marketing of all agricultural inputs is liberalized and
            further ensuring that no new subsidies on inputs is
            reintroduced; rationalizing the role of various ministries
            and agencies intervening in the agricultural sector, and
            undertaking a manpower review of the main agricultural
            extension units with a view to restructuring them; and
            assisting the Government to prepare a three year investment
            program which reflects clear sectoral priorities and the
            established project selection criteria agreed under the SAL I.
